articles.title: Tech Giants Race for Streaming Deals, but Twitch Remains King - The New York Times
articles.description: Facebook, Microsoft, Twitter and others are spending millions on video game streaming to compete with Amazon’s Twitch.
articles.content: Because Twitch has been around the longest, it has developed its own culture, with inside jokes tossed around on the chat logs that accompany live streams. That community has allowed streamers, who get most of their income from subscriptions and donations, to… [+1457 chars]

articles.author: Katharine Q. Seelye
articles.title: Goar Vartanyan, Celebrated Soviet Spy, Dies at 93
articles.description: Without her and her husband, also a Soviet spy, “the history of our world could have been different,” the Kremlin said. But her exact role remains secret.
articles.content:
The S.V.R. statement about Ms. Vartanyans death said that in 1943 she took part in a group that carried out operations to provide for security of the Tehran conference. 
This was no small task. The summit marked a rare wartime trip for Stalin out of the Sovi… [+1121 chars]

articles.author: Iliana Magra
articles.title: Greta Thunberg Is Taking a Holiday Break. ‘You Need to Take Rest.’
articles.description: The Swedish teenager who inspired a global movement is returning home, as admirers and critics weigh in.
articles.content:
Refusing to fly because of the outsize greenhouse gas emissions from aviation, she traveled across the Atlantic on an emissions-free yacht to make a fiery speech at the United Nations Climate Action Summit in New York in September this year.
Then in November… [+891 chars]

articles.title: Somebody’s Watching: Hackers Breach Ring Home Security Cameras - The New York Times
articles.description: Unnerved owners of the devices reported recent hacks in four states. The company reminded customers not to recycle passwords and user names.
articles.content: Our security team has investigated this incidentandwe have no evidence of an unauthorized intrusion or compromise of Rings systems or network, the statement said. Recently, we were made aware of an incident where malicious actors obtained some Ring users acco… [+1522 chars]

articles.author: Kimiko de Freytas-Tamura
articles.title: Can ‘Scooby Doo’ and the Rest of the Dollar Vans Go High-Tech?
articles.description: A shadow network of mini school buses that serves riders largely neglected by New York’s transit system has a new app.
articles.content:
About 120,000 people take dollar vans in New York City every day, about double the number from two decades ago, according to industry estimates. There are roughly 2,000 drivers, three-quarters of them operating illegally. 
Many van owners say stringent licen… [+1259 chars]

articles.author: Richard Sandomir
articles.title: Andrew Clements, 70, Dies; Wrote Best-Selling Children’s Books
articles.description: His best-known book, “Frindle,” posed a question about the nature of words: What would happen if you called a pen a frindle?
articles.content:
By turns amusing and adroit, this first novel is utterly satisfying, Kirkus Reviews wrote. The chess-like sparring between the gifted Nicholas and his crafty teacher is enthralling.
Frindle was followed by many more books for middle-grade students, including… [+1716 chars]

articles.description: Tom Perez has the worst job in American politics, and he beat Pete Buttigieg to get it.

articles.title: The Cost of Opioid Addiction

Re Before Christmas, Face the Darkness, by Tish Harrison Warren (Sunday Review, Dec. 1):
